pageContext.claim: “And I even -- I don't believe in polls because I see the fakest polls I've ever seen, but that poll is a 64 percent thing, which actually surprised me. We won World Wars out of these military bases.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is conflating two numbers from the ABC/Ipsos Poll, which found 64 percent of Americans support banning chokeholds in policing, while 56 percent oppose changing names of military bases named after Confederate leaders. The 727 person poll itself was not “fake.” Ipsos has a B- rating from FiveThirtyEight. The polling gurus did not rate it when working with ABC.
